title: How to Locate Saved Videos and Screenshots on Your PlayStation 4

steps.title: After switching on your PS4, you’ll be prompted to press the PS button.
steps.content: After switching on your PS4, you’ll be prompted to press the PS button. It's located at the center of your controller, and pressing it will enable your wireless PS4 controller and load the login screen on your television.

steps.title: Each user profile and icon is displayed when you first enable the controller.
steps.content: Each user profile and icon is displayed when you first enable the controller. Use the controller to highlight your user profile and press X to log in. Some user profiles require a password to log in. If your user profile requires a password, press the button combination on the controller you set up as your password.

steps.title: PlayStation 4’s interactive home screen is called the Dynamic Menu.
steps.content: PlayStation 4’s interactive home screen is called the Dynamic Menu. You can navigate around the Dynamic Menu using the arrow keys on your controller or the left stick. Press the right arrow key, and move all the way to the end of the menu icons where you’ll find the “Library.”

steps.title: Highlight the library icon (a stack of books) and press the X button.
steps.content: Highlight the library icon (a stack of books) and press the X button. This allows you to enter the Library. The Library contains all the various media saved on your PlayStation 4, such as games, apps, add-on purchases you’ve downloaded for different games, the Internet browser, music files, and many more.

steps.title: Select Applications.
steps.content: Select Applications . It's in the sidebar menu to the left next to an icon with 4 squares. Navigate to this option in the sidebar to the left and press X on the controller to open it.

steps.title: It has a blue icon with an image that resembles a photograph and a filmstrip.
steps.content: It has a blue icon with an image that resembles a photograph and a filmstrip. Navigate to this icon using the arrow keys on the controller and press X to open the Capture Gallery.

steps.title: It's below the large Capture Gallery icon on the left.
steps.content: It's below the large Capture Gallery icon on the left. Highlight this button with the controller and press X on the controller to open the app.

steps.title: Select the game or app you were using when you took the video or screenshot.
steps.content: Select the game or app you were using when you took the video or screenshot. All images and videos recorded in the Capture Gallery are organized by the game or app the image or video is from. Highlight the game or app that has images or video you want to view, and press X on the controller. This displays all videos and images from that game or app. Alternatively, you can select All to view all images and videos on your PlayStation 4. It has an icon that resembles a folder. Images have an icon that resembles a photograph with mountains in the lower-left corner. Videos have an image that resembles a filmstrip in the lower-left corner.

steps.title: Use the arrow buttons or left stick to highlight the image or video.
steps.content: Use the arrow buttons or left stick to highlight the image or video. Once you're on the image or video you want to view, press X on the controller to open it. This displays the video on the screen. Alternatively, you can press and hold the Share button on the controller to upload the video or photo to Facebook, Twitter, or YouTube. Then select the social media service you want to share the image or video to. You must link your Facebook, Twitter, or YouTube account to your PlayStation Network account to be able to share photos and videos online. To copy an image or video to a flash drive, insert the flash drive into one of the USB ports on the front of the PlayStation 4. Then highlight the image or video in the Capture Gallery and press Options on the controller. Select Copy to USB Storage Device in the menu to the right. The SHAREfactory app on PlayStation 4 lets you edit videos, create a video sequence, add intros, stickers, text, etc to videos and images on PlayStation 4.

steps.title: Once you’re done, press the O button on your controller.
steps.content: Once you’re done, press the O button on your controller. This takes you back to the Library menu. Press the O' button once more, and you’ll be taken back to the Dynamic Menu.
